passage:
(1) Rural landscapes across the world have undergone significant transformation over the past few decades, shifting from predominantly agricultural regions to more diverse economies. These changes have been driven by various factors including technological advancements, globalization, and changing economic priorities. Traditional farming practices that once defined countryside regions are increasingly being supplemented or replaced by modern agricultural techniques, tourism initiatives, and even remote working opportunities, fundamentally altering the character of rural communities.

(2) The modernization of rural areas has brought both benefits and challenges to local populations. On one hand, improved infrastructure, digital connectivity, and diversified economic opportunities have enhanced living standards and provided alternatives to agricultural employment. Many rural communities now have access to better healthcare, education, and commercial services than ever before. These developments have helped stem the tide of rural-to-urban migration in some regions, allowing younger generations to remain in their communities while pursuing contemporary careers.

(3) However, this transformation has not been without consequences for traditional rural lifestyles and cultural heritage. As agriculture becomes increasingly mechanized and commercialized, many traditional skills and practices that were passed down through generations are gradually disappearing. Local dialects, craft traditions, and community celebrations that were once integral to rural identity are being diluted by globalized culture. The intimate connection to the land that characterized rural life for centuries is becoming less common as fewer people depend directly on agriculture for their livelihoods.

(4) Environmental changes have also accompanied the transformation of rural landscapes. While some modernization efforts have promoted sustainable land management and conservation, others have contributed to habitat loss, soil degradation, and water pollution. Industrial agriculture, with its emphasis on monoculture and chemical inputs, has replaced more diverse traditional farming systems in many regions. At the same time, abandoned farmland in some areas has allowed for natural regeneration, creating new ecological niches and wildlife corridors.

(5) Looking toward the future, the challenge lies in finding a balance that preserves the cultural and ecological value of rural landscapes while allowing for economic development and improved quality of life. Some communities have successfully embraced this challenge by developing eco-tourism initiatives, promoting local food systems, or establishing cultural heritage programs. By thoughtfully integrating modern opportunities with traditional knowledge and practices, rural communities can potentially create resilient systems that honor their past while adapting to contemporary realities.

questions.question: Which verb form correctly completes the sentence? 'She _____ her homework by the time I arrived.'

options.A: Neither the students nor the teacher are ready.
options.B: Neither the students nor the teacher is ready.
options.C: Neither the students nor the teacher were ready.
options.D: Neither the students or the teacher is ready.

options.A: The Nile is the longest river in Africa.
options.B: She gave me an useful piece of advice.
options.C: I need to buy a new laptop for my studies.
options.D: We had dinner at the restaurant on Main Street.

options.C: The exhibition was opened by the mayor yesterday.

options.D: He said that he will call me the next day.

options.B: Technological advancements, globalization, and changing economic priorities

options.D: Increased autonomy from global economic trends

options.B: They are becoming more prominent in rural communities
options.C: They are being documented for historical records
options.D: They are gradually disappearing and being diluted

options.B: Developing eco-tourism and promoting local food systems

options.A: To argue that rural transformation is harmful to society
